name: The smallest deficient number that begins a run of at least n consecutive deficient numbers with the same number of prime factors (counted with multiplicity).
example: a(8) = 78021 because 78021 is the smallest deficient number that begins a run of 8 consecutive deficient numbers (78021, 78022, 78023, 78025, 78026, 78027,78028, 78029) with the same number of prime factors(counted with multiplicity), i.e. 3.

a(12) = 2535721 because 2535721 is the smallest deficient number that begins a run of 12 consecutive deficient numbers (2535721, 2535722, 2535723, 2535724, 2535725, 2535727, 2535729, 2535730, 2535731, 2535733, 2535734, 2535735) with the same number of prime factors(counted with multiplicity), i.e. 3.
author: _Shyam Sunder Gupta_, Oct 26 2024
